children.subject: Out of curiosity, which class is this for? And btw if this is a 40 hour/week, that's like 8 hours a day... which is kind of a lot, and I don't think you would have the time for another class. If it is 40 hrs for the entire summer, then I think that you can take a class on the side.

history.content:
The number of hours doesn't mean nearly as much as what your actual responsibilities are.

For example, are you expected to also teach four sections? In that case, you might not have physical time (during daylight hours) to both teach + go to class. Or are more hours from holding office hours, which are more flexible? 

Are some of your hours due to being a Head TA and covering miscellaneous stuff that comes up? How much work this would be would vary.

More generally, being hired for 40 hours != doing 40 hours of work. I've been hired for 30 hours, when I did <10 hours of week (which was silly and not what I signed up for nor what you should expect).

This is all assuming that you've actually received an offer, and aren't talking about theoreticals of what you're putting on your application, since I don't think I've actually heard of any 40 hour TAs, even during the summer. (My 30 hours was only because I was head TA.)

The number of hours doesn't mean nearly as much as what your actual responsibilities are.

For example, are you expected to also teach four sections? In that case, you might not have physical time (during daylight hours) to both teach + go to class. Or are more hours from holding office hours, which are more flexible? 

Are some of your hours due to being a Head TA and covering miscellaneous stuff that comes up? How much work this would be would vary.

More generally, being hired for 40 hours != doing 40 hours of work.
Hi there, the max TA appointment is 20 hours in most cases.

children.subject: 40 hr/week are extremely rare, and I don't know of it ever being given to a first time TA. Regardless, if somehow it happened, I would definitely not recommend also taking a class.

...er, I don't think this is related to the question at all?

Also, some people take summer courses to satisfy their major requirements, which are harder to satisfy at CCs.
"The class is a breadth course that shouldn't take as much as a technical"

Ah, didn't read that carefully enough.

You're still assuming that CCs have breadths that are Berkeley-quality / suitable replacements for a Berkeley course though. And if they did, they would have similar workloads.

I would explore community college options, specifically online. You can achieve any breadth online at a local community college, at a much cheaper price (~$50) than paying the $1k+ to take a course here at Berkeley. Also, Berkeley has breadth courses online, in the case of PS145A, though it does not optimize the cost issue.

history.content:
Hello everyone,

How feasible is it to TA for 40 hours and take a class? The class is a breadth course that shouldn't take as much as a technical but is a sizable amount of time. The TAing would take up a large amount of time, so I was wondering if it'd be able to do both.
history.subject: Summer 40 hour TA + 1 Class
